channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report E-2024100128
item.description:
Report E-2024100128

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-22
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CIRCLE K
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 25000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 500-gallons of gasoline released from one (1) tanker truck due to the driver attempting to switch trailers, but the weight was too heavy, causing the landing gear to go through the bottom of the trailer and the tank fell on the ground. The release impacted the asphalt parking lot and ditch that is in the center of the parking lot. Emergency response contractor HEPACO arrived on site and performed an initial clean up and collected an estimated 11,000 gallons of Liquid waste from the ditch and placed it into a frac-tank. The soil ditch area is pending remediation. No storm drains were reported impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2024090539
item.description:
Report E-2024090539

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: APOPKA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RDX, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On August 21, 2024, RDX contacted Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) of a release in Apopka FL. It was reported that 1100 gallons of Azone 15 was due to a roll over accident where police and fire department were onsite, the release impacted asphalt and soil. It was reported that the impacted area was 200ft x 8ft and 1100 gallons released, 50 gallons were confined inside the trailer and the rest impacted the roadside and the soil. Hull was dispatched to perform all onsite clean-up activities. A wrecker was called to load the trailer involved in the accident, once turned upright there was product found in the bottom of the trailer which as neutralized and solidified. Hulls has (9) 250 gallons totes that were savaged and send back to the shipper. (2) roll offs containing impacted soil, oil dry and damaged totes were used for disposal.
